intro: Hypenia ocymoides, commonly known as the small-leaf hypenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Hypenia ocymoides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
